bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Reverend Dr. Reese F. Alsop was made rector of St. Ann's Church in Brooklyn in 1886. Alsop studied law in Philadelphia, PA, before undertaking theological studies at the Philadelphia Divinity School. Prior to becoming rector of St. Ann's Church, Alsop led Episcopalian congregations in Framingham, MA; Newton's Corner, N.Y.; Rye, N.Y.; Pittsburgh, PA; and Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One volume of handwritten aphorisms, biblical quotes, and notes on ethics and religion, with a glossary of terms, created by Reese F. Alsop in 1873 while residing and preaching in Rye, N.Y. The writings are contained in a pre-printed indexed volume designed to aid individuals in the cultivation of moral improvement, with an introduction and instructions on how to use the book by John Todd, D.D. Though the vast majority of the writings are in English, a small portion are in French.
